items.title: `throttling.BaseThrottling.wait` has the wrong type
items.body: The stubs define the return type of `wait` as `Optional[int]` but [one of the implementations](https://github.com/encode/django-rest-framework/blob/master/rest_framework/throttling.py#L149-L162) seems to indicate that it should be `Optional[float]`.

items.title: Request incorrectly disallows ForcedAuthentication
items.body: Fields like `Request.successful_authenticator` can be a `ForcedAuthentication` - there's [code in DRF](https://github.com/encode/django-rest-framework/blob/4b06e0a5a114b7631bd237e29e2d6d22412a50bd/rest_framework/request.py#L180) that does this . The type stubs only allow `BaseAuthentication`s, but`ForcedAuthentication` doesn't derive from `BaseAuthentication`. I'd be happy to submit a PR for this.

items.title: error: "HttpRequest" has no attribute "query_params"
items.body:
This code produces a false-positive `mypy` error:

```python
class MyViewset(
    mixins.ListModelMixin,
    GenericViewSet,
):
    def get_queryset(self):
        office_id = int(self.request.query_params['office_id'])  # here
        ...
```

Output:

```
» mypy server
server/rest_app/views.py:144: error: "HttpRequest" has no attribute "query_params"
Found 1 errors in 1 files (checked 199 source files)
```

Versions:

- `djangorestframework-stubs@1.2`

My wild guest is that `self.request` is considered to be `server/rest_app/views.py:144: note: Revealed type is 'django.http.request.HttpRequest'` there, not the `Request` provided by the `drf`.

This fixes the issue:

```python
class MyViewset(
    mixins.ListModelMixin,
    GenericViewSet,
):
    request: Request
```

items.title: ModelSerializer missing Meta attribute
items.body:
`ModelSerializer` should a have `Meta` attribute with `model`, since it cannot be initialized without it.

Is there any reason why it isn't already included?

I can make a PR with the fix.

items.title: Please do a new release
items.body: Several improvements have been merged into djangorestframework-stubs since the last release on December 12, I would appreciate a new release. :)

items.title: Copy CONTRIBUTING.md from django-stubs
items.body: https://github.com/typeddjango/django-stubs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

items.title: paginate_queryset should be the same type as django Paginator
items.body: The `queryset` parameter in `paginate_queryset` is passed as an argument to Django `Paginator.__init__` class. The Django class allows a wider set of types `Union[SupportsLen, SupportsCount, SupportsOrdered]`, not only querysets. I think that DRF should reflect this in some way.

items.title: Wrong typing for Exception.detail
items.body:
For now type of `APIException.detail` is `_Detail = Union[str, Dict[str, Any]]`. But it also could be a list.

A possible solution is to set `_Detail = Union[str, List[Any], Dict[str, Any]]`. Would you mind if I make a PR?

items.title: ModelViewSet is missing action attribute
items.body:
Already briefly mentioned in issue https://github.com/typeddjango/djangorestframework-stubs/issues/9

The `action` attribute is defined in [`ViewSetMixin.initialize_request`](https://github.com/encode/django-rest-framework/blob/master/rest_framework/viewsets.py#L131-L143), which is called from [`APIView.dispatch`](https://github.com/encode/django-rest-framework/blob/d985c7cbb999b2bc18a109249c583e91f4c27aec/rest_framework/views.py#L481-L488), AFAICS. The point is that, while it is possible to get a view that has no `action` attribute (by overriding `dispatch` as part of some nasty agenda :D ) in normal use any view that inherits form `ViewSetMixin` will have a `self.action`.

I think we should add a type annotation for this attribute in the stubs.

items.title: CursorPaginator.ordering should allow a list of strings
items.body:
Having something like this in the code...

``` python
class Pagination(pagination.CursorPagination):
    ordering = ("-created_at", "pk")
```

... throws a typing error:

```
 .../pagination.py:123: error: Incompatible types in assignment (expression has type "Tuple[str, str]", base class "CursorPagination" defined the type as "str")
        ordering = ("-created_at", "pk")
                    ^
```

  .
  

The [docs](https://www.django-rest-framework.org/api-guide/pagination/#configuration_2) say:

> * ordering = This should be a string, or list of strings, indicating the field against which... 

The [code](https://github.com/encode/django-rest-framework/blob/master/rest_framework/pagination.py#L820-L828) says:

``` python
class CursorPagination(BasePagination):
    ...
    def get_ordering(self, request, queryset, view):
        ...
        assert isinstance(ordering, (str, list, tuple)), (
            'Invalid ordering. Expected string or tuple, but got {type}'.format(
                type=type(ordering).__name__
            )
        )

        if isinstance(ordering, str):
            return (ordering,)
        return tuple(ordering)
```

items.title: Support serializer as ListField child
items.body:
When using `ListField` with a *serializer* as child, mypy throws **assignment error**.

In stubs, child is typed as `Field`. FYI, Serializer extends Field through BaseSerializer.

**Example:**
```py
class Item(Serializer):
    name = CharField()

class MySerializer(Serializer):
    items = ListField(child=Item())  # errors [assignment]
```

```console
error: Incompatible types in assignment (expression has type "ListField", base class "Mapping" defined the type as "Callable[[Mapping[str, BoundField]], AbstractSet[Tuple[str, BoundField]]]")  [assignment]
```

items.title: New release
items.body:
A version bump and pypi release would be great.

Thanks

...also, a lot of pypi releases is missing as github tags/releases.

items.title: Querysets are typed wrong since django-stubs 1.1.0
items.body: Since version 1.1.0 of django-stubs, `QuerySet` no longer takes two generic parameters. This is the reason the build is currently failing with a bunch of `"QuerySet" expects 1 type argument, but 2 given` errors. This change was introduced in https://github.com/typeddjango/django-stubs/commit/656105bab2d1da30b5273ab0e6272b74d4ed6236#diff-b2dbe3c4313d37ea08b37f9a3dea0e77, which also includes some other changes to query sets. https://github.com/typeddjango/django-stubs/commit/fc9a335dfde1d27e47c22a55e3c2e8921fd132b3 made some additional changes. Because of the other changes I'm not sure if the correct solution is to just drop the second generic parameter or if there's more to it.

items.title: Support for Mypy 0.730
items.body: Mypy 0.730 have been released and `setup.py` specifies `mypy>=0.720,<0.730` while django-stubs specifies `mypy>=0.730` in `1.2.0`. See: https://github.com/typeddjango/django-stubs/blob/master/setup.py#L24

items.title: Typings for Field attributes
items.body:
Currently a lot of Field's attributes are not exposed in types, eg:

```
error: "ChoiceField" has no attribute "field_name"
error: "Field" has no attribute "allow_blank"
error: "Field" has no attribute "allow_null"
error: "Field" has no attribute "default"; maybe "get_default"?
error: "Field" has no attribute "read_only"
error: "Field" has no attribute "required"
```

that cause a lot of headache when serializers modified dynamically.

items.title: Incompatible with django-stubs
items.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. `git clone .`
2. Install deps
3. `pytest`

```
____________________ test_client_methods_return_response_objects _____________________
/Users/sobolev/Documents/github/djangorestframework-stubs/test-data/typecheck/test_client.test:9: 
E   pytest_mypy.utils.TypecheckAssertionError: Invalid output: 
E   Expected:
E     main:8: error: Revealed type is 'rest_framework.response.Response' (diff)
E   Actual:
E     ../../../../../../Users/sobolev/Documents/github/djangorestframework-stubs/.venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django-stubs/test/testcasesi:50: error: Argument 1 of "__call__" is incompatible with supertype "TestCase"; supertype defines the argument type as "Optional[TestResult]" (diff)
E     main:8: note: Revealed type is 'rest_framework.response.Response' (diff)
E   
E   Alignment of first line difference:
E     E: main:8: error: Revealed type is 'rest_framework.response.Response'...
E     A: ../../../../../../Users/sobolev/Documents/github/djangorestframework-stu...
E        ^
============================= 11 failed in 21.22 seconds =============================

```

It all started with this commit: https://travis-ci.org/mkurnikov/djangorestframework-stubs/builds/516914597

I guess, the change is unrelated. Only timing is important.

items.title: why add the plugin to config file when it works without it anyway?
items.body:
Hi,
first off - thanks for the effort of maintaining this!

Now, the question:

Consider this example
```
from rest_framework.response import Response
from rest_framework.views import APIView


class PushStateToChatView(APIView):
    renderer_classes = ['a', 'b']
    def post(self) -> Response:
        return Response({'status': 'ok'})

```

this produces mypy errors:

```
mypy api/partners/views.py
api/partners/views.py:9: error: List item 0 has incompatible type "str"; expected "Type[BaseRenderer]"
api/partners/views.py:9: error: List item 1 has incompatible type "str"; expected "Type[BaseRenderer]"
```

and - watch this: **it works even without adding the `mypy_drf_plugin.main` to `mypy.ini`.**

So, can you please show an example of something that works only if the plugin is added to `mypy.ini` - and does not work without it?

Cheers!

items.title: Add stub for filters
items.body: Thx

items.title: Support serializer field with name "fields"
items.body:
Consider the case:

```python
 class FieldsSerializer(serializers.Serializer):
     ...
 
 
 class OtherSerializer(serializers.Serializer):
    fields = FieldsSerializer()
```

Mypy will complain with: `error: Incompatible types in assignment (expression has type "FieldsSerializer", base class "Serializer" defined the type as "Dict[str, Field]")`

items.title: Missing stubs for rest_framework.documentation
items.body:
After installing `djangorestframework-stubs` I get errors on the following line:

```python
from rest_framework.documentation import include_docs_urls
```

items.title: adding stubs fro test packages
items.body:
Hi, appreciate all the work. I just tried to install & use this in my project that's using DRF. However in the end i had to remove it because the test package stubs are missing. Not a huge deal in its own, but because im using an IDE it couldn't determine that `APISimpleTestCase` was an actual `TestCase` so all the nice features for running individual suites / tests started to fail :)

I'm not that familiar with python & mypy yet but when i am ill try and return and help out and add them in :)

items.title: Module 'rest_framework' has no attribute 'routers'
items.body:
Hi, you are doing great work!

The following code causes the problem for me

```
from rest_framework import routers
__ROUTER = routers.DefaultRouter()

```

```
main\rest_api\urls.py:4: error: Module 'rest_framework' has no attribute 'routers'
```
